headline: Helicopter in Deadly Accident Lacked Terrain Safety System
abstract: The N.T.S.B. has long advised installing ground warning systems on helicopters, but the aircraft carrying Mr. Bryant did not have the voluntary system.
lead_paragraph: In 2004, a helicopter flying at night over the Gulf of Mexico plunged into the water, killing all 10 people on board. Had the aircraft been equipped with a system to warn the pilots of the impending impact, the crash could have been prevented, investigators for the National Transportation Safety Board determined.
